item.description:

item.title: Many Wavelengths to Serve You
item.description:
When your network reaches its maximum capacity, you typically need to upgrade to a faster network with faster components. Upgrading your entire network infrastructure can be extremely expensive. However, with fiber optic networks, you can significantly increase bandwidth within the same cables using a technique called Wavelength Division Multiplexing (WDM). WDM allows multiple light beams to transmit data simultaneously over a single fiber optic cable. Each beam operates on a different wavelength, increasing capacity proportionally to the number of beams...

item.title: Ethernet Point of Presence Locator
item.description:

Think of it as a station for accessing high-speed data and voice services.
